thread.title: Right to be forgotten is global, EU tells Google
thread.title_full: Right to be forgotten is global, EU tells Google

title: Right to be forgotten is global, EU tells Google
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Right to be forgotten is global, EU tells Google A spokeswoman for Google said the company 'respectfully disagreed' with the ruling Justin Sullivan/Getty Images James Dean Technology Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, September 22 2015 
Google has been ordered to extend the “right to be forgotten” across the world after the French privacy watchdog rejected its argument that it should be confined to Europe. 
Google was instructed yesterday to remove links from its search engines outside Europe, such as google.com, to comply with a ruling by the European Court of Justice (ECJ). The company maintains that the judgment applies only to search engines within Europe, such as google.co.uk and google.fr. 
The ECJ’s ruling in May last year gave individuals the right to ask search engines to remove links to websites containing inaccurate, inadequate, irrelevant or Subscribe now
